instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_LSOC_RST_L: What is SMC_LSOC_RST_L? SMC_LSOC_RST_L is a signal that comes out of the trackpad on Macbook Airs that can reset the SMC.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shuts Down during boot.
threads.message:
Came in with liquid damage- Computer turns on, but suddenly powers off while trying to load OS from either the internal SSD or external USB drive. The crash usually takes place towards the end of the boot process, but not specifically the same time every time. I have found if I disconnect KB/TP cable the OS will boot into the OS without crashing. I so far have tried new KB/TP Cable, new TP, new KB and have replaced the KB/TP connector as well.

Visibly Affected areas-

<CHIP>U1930</CHIP>/ replaced
<CAPACITOR>C7601</CAPACITOR>/ replaced
<CAPACITOR>C5021</CAPACITOR>/ replaced
L5001/ replaced
KB Connector/ replaced

Minor pad damage around SMC

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shuts Down during boot.
threads.message: Reflow the SMC just in case. The trackpad does attach to the PCH, so hopefully, that is not the issue. I would bet on crap under the SMC tho

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shuts Down during boot.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shuts Down during boot.
threads.message: That was it! Thanks again man, have a good one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shuts Down during boot.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shuts Down during boot.
threads.message:
Hello, this board just came back from customer experiencing the same issue. turns on oots, but crashes randomly. It will still  boot completely normal if TP/KB cable is unplugged. This time I replaced the SMC and repaired a small pad (93) as well. Issue also occurs in SMC bypass mode. I have replaced the connector and have checked values on <RESISTOR>R4850</RESISTOR>- 53 and <RESISTOR>R4860</RESISTOR>. The board is actually a 00165 (sorry about that, I dont know why I put 3437). 

Thanks, sorry for the repeat issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shuts Down during boot.
threads.message:
Monitor <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> signal, when trackpad connected.
You can also cut off <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> line to J4800 and see if it works good with trackpad connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shuts Down during boot.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> stays between 3.399V - 3.4 V the entire time.  Also disconnected <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> from the trackpad connector without change in behavior. 

Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shuts Down during boot.
threads.message: Now disconnect <SIGNAL>SMC_LSOC_RST_L</SIGNAL> from J4800 and test it...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shuts Down during boot.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Shuts Down during boot.
threads.message:
Are you 100% sure the issue comes up only with trackpad/keyboard connected?
Disconnect trackpad flex and test it half day, even more.

Also let trackpad connected, but disconnect keyboard flex from trackpad board.
Test again for long time.
